alert.note: Alert for Gila Bend; Sonoran Desert Natl Monument; Tonopah Desert (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 1:24PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa County through 200 PM MST... At 123 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sonoran National Monument, or 10 miles east of Gila Bend. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gila Bend, Estrella, Bosque and Sonoran National Monument. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 121 and 131. AZ Route 238 between mile markers 2 and 17. AZ Route 85 between mile markers 122 and 127. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Gila Bend; Sonoran Desert Natl Monument; Tonopah Desert
